## Useful packages

-   patchwork for putting plots together

-   Plotly for interactive plot

-   esquisse to make basic plots by dragging and dropping elements

-   Euler for making venn diagram

-   ggbeeswarm package for violin point plots

-   ggtree and ape for building trees

-   gt for making tables

-   ggrepel for labeling

-   ggally for multivariate plotes

-   ggmagnify for making magnified insets for area of interest

-   devtools to get files or packages from github

-   exists function to check if a function with specific name exists in R

-   ggforce to provide missiing functions through ggplot extenstions

-   <https://exts.ggplot2.tidyverse.org/gallery/>

-   <https://posit.co/resources/cheatsheets/>

## working with multilayer labels

extract the column names from each layer. depending on what information from the title and column are imporatant assign the names.

```{r error=TRUE}
fig_E_data <- sheets[[4]]
fig_E_data <- fig_E_data[-c(1,2), ]
fig_E_data_gonad <- fig_E_data[ , c(1:12)]
second_header <- fig_E_data_gonad[1,]
second_header_col_names <- unname(unlist(second_header))
second_header_two <- second_header[,c(1,3,5,7,9,11)]
names(fig_E_data_gonad) <- second_header_col_names
names(fig_E_data_gonad)[c(2,4,6,8,10,12)] <- second_header_two
fig_E_data_gonad <- fig_E_data_gonad[-c(1,2), ]
fig_E_data_gonad <- fig_E_data_gonad[,c(2,4,6,8,10,12)]
```
